alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 5:23PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Miami-Dade County through 600 PM EDT... At 523 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pennsuco, or 7 miles west of Hialeah, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hialeah, Miramar, Miami Gardens, Doral, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Miami Springs, Medley, Intersection Krome And U.S. 27, Palm Springs North, Pennsuco and Country Club. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Florida.
